item.title: User Research 101
item.description: My life changed fundamentally in the Fall of 2008. I was entering my 3rd year at the University of Rochester where I was double-majoring in Computer Science and Psychology. Up until that point, these were two things I studied in parallel, and had yet to discover the niche they intersect in. That is, until Carman Neustaedter, then working as a Research Scientist at Kodak in Rochester, taught a class as an adjunct called “Introduction to Human-Computer Interaction”.
